pr_title: GEODE-8765: Fix NullPointerException when group-transaction-events an…

timeline.message:
GEODE-8765: Fix NullPointerException when group-transaction-events and events in and not in transactions are sent.

A NullPointerException (caught later in the code) was
generated when events without a transactionId in
gateway sender queues were retrieved to complete
transactions.
The problem was that equals was invoked on a
possibly null object (the transactionId).
The call has been rewritten to avoid the
NullPointer exception.

The NullPointerException had different undesired effects
in the Parallel and in the Serial Gateway senders.

In Parallel Gateway Senders it can provoke that events
are left in the queue without ever being drained
although all events are replicated.
In Serial Gateway Senders, the effect is much
more severe as once the NullPointerException is
reached, no events from the queue are replicated.

GEODE-8765: Fix NullPointerException when group-transaction-events and events in and not in transactions are sent.

A NullPointerException (caught later in the code) was
generated when events without a transactionId in
gateway sender queues were retrieved to complete
transactions.
The problem was that equals was invoked on a
possibly null object (the transactionId).
The call has been rewritten to avoid the
NullPointer exception.

The NullPointerException had different undesired effects
in the Parallel and in the Serial Gateway senders.

In Parallel Gateway Senders it can provoke that events
are left in the queue without ever being drained
although all events are replicated.
In Serial Gateway Senders, the effect is much
more severe as once the NullPointerException is
reached, no events from the queue are replicated.

timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: While not part of the changes in this PR, this method could be inlined, since it's used in only one place and is only one line.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: As with the similar method in ParallelGatewaySenderQueue, this method could also be inlined.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: The compiler warning on this line and several others can be resolved by making batch a List<AsyncEvent<?,?>> here and the other places it's used. The lines requiring this change are 416, 421, 431-432, 438, 479 and 526.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: To make the numbering a little more consistent, could this event's key be 2, and the subsequent events have their key values increased by 1? That way the calls to bucketRegionQueue.addToQueue() will have matching keys with the keys here.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: These calls to Long.valueOf() can be replaced with just 1L, 2L etc.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: Is it necessary to create a new overloaded method here? There is already a method setNumDispatcherThreadsForTheRun() in WANTestBase that allows this value to be set to whatever is desired.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText:
Compiler warnings on this line can be fixed by using
final Map<Object, Object> keyValuesInTransactions = new HashMap<>();
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText:
Compiler warnings on this line can be fixed by using
final Map<Object, Object> keyValuesNotInTransactions = new HashMap<>();
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: The compiler warning here can be removed by using AsyncInvocation<Void>.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: The compiler warning here can be removed by using AsyncInvocation<Void>.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: All comments that apply to ParallelWANPropagationDUnitTest also apply to this test method, since the code in both tests is largely identical.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText:
This variable is never used, so these lines could be just
ParallelGatewaySenderHelper.createParallelGatewaySenderEventProcessor(this.sender);
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.message: GEODE-8765: Code clean up after review
